rooms.Name: Section Chief Scott Blevins' office
rooms.Description:
The first thing you notice upon entering this office is how tidy it is.
This office is well-lit and the windows are wide-opened to allow fresh air
to ventilate throughout.  There's a man sitting behind a desk working on a
personal computer.  He seems to be writing a report or a personnel profile
of someone.  The man doesn't seem to sense your presence in this room as he
is busy working hard on his task.

rooms.Name: Walter Skinner's office
rooms.Description:
This office is not very well-lit and it's pretty stuffy in here.  The
windows are kept shut and the main light switches are taped so that they
will not be turned on.  There are couches here on both sides of the room
and the walls here are bare.  A large desk is lying on the middle of this
office and someone is sitting behind it.  He looks like a smei bald-headed
man with glasses.  He seems to be busy talking on the phone and he's
careful not to speak too loud...because the walls have ears...

rooms.Name: The 3rd Floor (north hallway)
rooms.Description:
There's a door here guarded by two alert security officers.  They seem to
have their hands on their side arms everytime someone approaches them.
Someone in there must be pretty darn important for the guards to behave in
this manner.  The name label on the door reads 'Assistant Director of the
F.B.I. Walter S. Skinner.'

rooms.Name: The 3rd Floor (west hallway)
rooms.Description:
There's nothing unusual about this area of the floor.  Security guards are
walking behind you and you can feel them staring at you as though you were
a shoplifter in a store.  The elevator entrance is just east of where
your're standing and the hallway continues south.

rooms.Name: The 3rd Floor (west hallway)
rooms.Description:
There are lots of guards here passing you by and looking you up and down as
though you're under suspicion.  A door is located west of here and there's
a name label on this door thtat reads 'Section Chief Scott Blevins.'  The
hallway continues south and north of here.

rooms.Name: The 3rd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
You can feel the security cameras immediately zoom into your direction as
you walk into this area of the floor.  The cameras here record all areas
in the building making sure that foreign spies could not leave here with
top-secret files.

rooms.Name: The 3rd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
Security guards are still here checking ID badges and security is tighter
than ever.  Anyone who is caught in a suspicious act is immediately
confined to a holding cell.  This hallway continues east and west of where
you're standing.

rooms.Name: The 3rd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
This entire hallway seems to go in circles and you're beginning to wonder
where's the exit from this floor.  This hallway is dull much like the other
hallways on the other floors.  Each area is so much alike that it's hard to
remeber where you've been or came in from.

rooms.Name: The 3rd Floor (east hallway)
rooms.Description:
There's nothing different in this area of the hallway.  The guards are
still behind you making sure that you're not here to cause any problems.  A
door is located east of here and the label on that door reads 'Section
Chief Joseph McGrath.'

rooms.Name: The 3rd Floor (east hallway)
rooms.Description:
You notice that the security guards here are checking your every movement
and they seem to be following you to make sure you're not trying anything
funny.  There are hidden security cameras on all parts of this floor.  The
hallway continues west and south of here.

rooms.Name: The 3rd Floor (elevator entrance)
rooms.Description:
There seems to be more security officers here than the two previous floors
beneath you.  The officers seem to be checking badges of every single
visitor on this floor and they're about to check yours as well.  This
hallway continues east and west of here, and to your north there's a door
guarded by two security officers.  The elevator entrance/exit is just south
of where you're standing.

rooms.Name: Inside the elevator (at the 3rd Floor)
rooms.Description:
As soon as you arrive at this level of the elevator, a computerized voice
tells you that only personnel with priority one clearance may pass through
this door.  The computer access panel is here waiting for you to slide in
your access card so that they can validate your ID.

rooms.Name: Fox Mulder's secret files
rooms.Description:
There are about ten large file cabinets stacked on top of one another.  
Each cabinet seems to be filled with information of top-secret files that
even the most higher-ups in the Pentagon have never seen.  Each cabinet
seems to be locked and probably only Fox Mulder has the key to access to
these files.

rooms.Name: Further inside a secret entrance
rooms.Description:
The darkness is making you trip and bump into anything that is lying in the
middle of the walkway.  This entrance seems to be built within the very
walls of the F.B.I. building and probably only this 'Agent Mulder' knows
about this secret area.

rooms.Name: Inside a secret entrance
rooms.Description:
It's very dark in here...  What could be lying south of this secret
entrance, you think to yourself.  There is no light switch in this room and
you can't sense anything dangerous near here.

rooms.Name: Fox Mulder's office
rooms.Description:
This office is a complete mess.  Everywhere you look there are documents,
books, journals, and research paper lying on the tables, chairs, and even
the floor.  There are also food cartons and coffee cups stacked to the top
in a small garbage can.  The walls are covered corner to corner by hundreds
of articles that seem to focus mostly on U.F.O. sitings and abductions.  In
the middle of the room, there's a small desk and two agents are here
sitting next together discussingon something.  One of the special agents is
a man and he seems to be doing his research using his computer, and the
other special agent is a gorgeous red-haired woman who is here studying
curiously on what the other agent is doing.  As you look around this small
office, you notice an outline on the wall of what seems to be some sort of
a secret entrance south of here.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
There's a door south of here and on that door a label reads 'Special Agent
Fox Mulder.'  A poster is also taped to the door.  It's a picture of a
flying saucer of some sort and the words on it reads 'The Truth is Out
There...'  There are people inside this office as you try to listen in on
their conversation.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
The south hallway seems to a complete stop here but it really
continues south of here.  And at a distance, south of where you're standing
there's a door there.  The lights around this area seem to be dimmer than
the rest of the hallway.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
The tedium of walking back and forth trying to find your way around this
floor is beginning to make you think twice about getting out of this area.
This hallway seems to continue all the way east and west of here.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
The southern hallway of this floor seems to be endless.  The walk from
east-to-west and west-to-east is beginning to confuse your sense of
direction.  There are agents here moving quickly passing you by as though
they seem to be in a hurry.

rooms.Name: Dana Scully's office
rooms.Description:
Amazingly this office is tidy unlike most of the offices here in the
building.  Not only is the place clean but it also smells nice.  There's a
desk in the middle of the room and on top of it, there's a picture of a
beautiful woman.  She has pretty shoulder-length red hair and pouty red
lips to match...she's just gorgeous.  Suddenly, you sense you're not alone
in this room.  Someone else is here and she seems to be waiting patiently
for someone, probably the cute woman-agent in the photo.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
You're standing before a door south of here.  The label on this door reads
'Special Agent Dana Scully.'  As you were about to walk away you sense
someone is inside this room.  It's probably just this 'Agent Scully' doing
her business in there.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
There's nothing special to look at around here.  Agents and security
officers are just everywhere on this floor and everyone here seems busy
with some task at hand.  From a distance, south of where you're standing,
an office door is located there.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (west hallway)
rooms.Description:
There are no paintings on the walls and monuments standing on the sides of
the hallway.  All you see around this section of the floor are special
agents walking pass you carrying loads of documents on their arms.  From a
distance, you can see the elevator is just located east of here.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (west hallway)
rooms.Description:
You are immediately bored by this area of the hallway because there's nothing
exciting going on around this place.  The special agents here are just
working diligently on their tasks and they don't have time to give you a
tour to their rooms.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
Special agents from all departments in the building are moving back and
forth trying to get things done.  Everyone here looks hard-working and
dedicated to their work.  The south hallway continues all the way east and
west of here and the west hallway is to your north.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (south hallway)
rooms.Description:
You've reached an intersection between three hallways.  The southern
hallway seems to lead to an office there.  The west hallway looks like it
stretches for miles and the east hallway seems much shorter.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (east hallway)
rooms.Description:
The hallway here looks like a maze to confuse people.  The walls and floors
are all alike and there's no way to track a route from one place to
another.  The confusion has made you go in circles as you try to find your
way around this labyrinth.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (east hallway)
rooms.Description:
You notice there are security cameras placed at a ceiling everywhere you
go.  The F.B.I. wants to make sure that no one without authorization may
wander into this building without notice.  This hallway continues south and
north of here.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (east hallway)
rooms.Description:
There's nothing exciting happening around here.  All you see are special
agents moving from room to room carry research documents and security
equipment from one place to another.  This hallway continues west and south
of where you're standing.

rooms.Name: The 2nd Floor (elevator entrance)
rooms.Description:
An elevator is located south of here and there's an access panel that's
ready to validate your access card.  You can see the security camera up on
the ceiling zooming in to your direction making sure you don't fool around 
with panel.  This 2nd Floor hallway continues east and west.

rooms.Name: Inside the elevator (at the 2nd Floor)
rooms.Description:
The elevator stops here at the 2nd Floor but the doors doesn't
automatically open.  Instead a computerized voice coming out from a speaker
panel requests for an identification card.  It seems all floor in this
F.B.I. building requires an access verification of some sort.

rooms.Name: Inside a research confinement
rooms.Description:
The first thing you notice upone entering this room is the frightened man
sitting in the corner with his arms and hands covering his face.  It's as
though he fears someone or something would come inside this room and take
him away.  The poor man keeps muttering about 'them' coming back for him.
This mental patient looks harmless but WATCHOUT!  He's know to have killed
a few people and kidnapped an F.B.I. agent.

rooms.Name: Inside a research confinement
rooms.Description:
As you walk inside this room, you sense that there's danger all around you.
A danger by the name of Eugene Tooms, a mental patient who loves to murder
and mutilate his victims for their livers!  You can hear heavy breathing in
the darkness but you can't see where Tooms is around this room.  He's
hiding like a natural predator until he's ready to strike...

rooms.Name: A top-secret research laboratory
rooms.Description:
You are amazed by what you see around you.  Some of the patients here
aren't like any human on earth...these patients look more like outer space
aliens!  You can't take your eyes off the strange patients all around you.
There's also a strange humanoid 'fish-man' chained inside a large fish tank
next to a wall.  Also you see a grey-skin man with lesions covering most of
his face.  This laboratory is more like a circus freak show than any
research department.

rooms.Name: A top-secret research laboratory
rooms.Description:
There are things here that are not meant for anyone outside the department
to see.  Everywhere you look, there are patients here in straitjackets and
their mouths are in protective muffles.  The patients here must be pretty
dangerous to let loose around this room and some of them are acting
violently as you walk close to them.

rooms.Name: The Research for the Unexplained Department
rooms.Description:
There's a large door with an access card panel next to it.  There must be
something important behind this door that only the most qualified, rank and
experience, may enter inside.  The large sign on this door reads 
'AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY - trespassers will be prosecuted.'

rooms.Name: The Research for the Unexplained Department
rooms.Description:
There are a lot of activities going on west of here and most of the
scientists stationed in this department are crowded there.  A door is
located south of where you're standing and the door label reads 'Mental
Patient: Eugene Victor Tooms - DO NOT ENTER.'

rooms.Name: The Research for the Unexplained Department
rooms.Description:
You've been inside this department for some time now and you notice that
there's a 'whispering' on the loud speakers.  You try to make out the words
from this whispering and the only words you can understand are 'deny
everything...'  The F.B.I. must be trying to brainwash their employees with
subliminal messages so that they would not leak out top-secret information.

rooms.Name: The Research for the Unexplained Department
rooms.Description:
This strange area of the building is beginning to make you think twice
before going any further.  Security guards are everywhere and you can see
surveillance cameras on the ceiling zooming back and forth.  This Research
Department continues east and west.

rooms.Name: The Research for the Unexplained Department
rooms.Description:
Everywhere you look, doctors and scientists are running back and forth
tending to their tasks.  You can see doctors and their assistants here
moving patients on medical emergency beds.  The patients on these beds
don't look anything like human beings to you -- they have large, dark
almond eyes and their skin pigment is unlike anything you've seen on a
normal person.

rooms.Name: The Research for the Unexplained Department
rooms.Description:
Only the most qualified scientists and doctors may enter this section of
the floor.  This is the area where the F.B.I. doesn't want anyone to know
about and what Fox Mulder and the 'Lone Gunmen' are trying to uncover to
the public.  The secrets in this large department could put the nation in a
widespread panic and thus everything in this department is national
security.  There's a door north of here and the label on this door reads
'Mental Patient: Duane Barry - DO NOT ENTER.'

rooms.Name: A smoke-filled room
rooms.Description:
It's dark as heck in here!  The light-switch doesn't seem to be functional
and the smoke doesn't help much either.  Someone is definitely here and
he's sitting behind a desk.  The silhouette figure behind the desk seems to
be that of a man smoking a cigarette.  He's talking on the phone and 
whispering every single word from his mouth.  The conversation must be 
important that he didn't sense your presence here in his office.  As you
look over his desk you see his ash tray filled to the top with ashes and
cigarette butts.  This strange man is going to die from lung cancer before
he reaches his prime.

rooms.Name: The Paranormal/Psychic Research Department
rooms.Description:
There are a lot of scientists and doctors here performing tests of all
sorts in this room.  You notice a strange 'sensation' as you walk inside
this laboratory.  There's an aura that surrounds some of the patients here
and the feeling you get from what the auras emit is something you can't
find the words to explain.  Suddenly, you feel a sharp pain in your head
as though something is 'squeezing' your brain for information.  The blood
from your nose pour out quickly and you feel yourself losing consciousness.
The psychic energy in this room is too much to bear for someone who has no
experience dealing with psychics and paranormals.

rooms.Name: The Cryogenics Research Lab
rooms.Description:
You are in awe as you walk inside this large research laboratory.  There
are large steel cannisters here lying beside the walls and tubes of strange
liquid are being fed into them.  It's about thirty degrees in this room and
you feel yourself shivering from this freezing temperature.  There's a
strange man here just sitting there and staring at one of the cannisters.
He doesn't look like he works around this lab and you're not about to ask
him what is his business in this room.

rooms.Name: Inside a dark holding cell
rooms.Description:
It's getting darker and darker as you go further and further into this
strange holding cell.  You sense you're not alone inside this room -- you
can hear heavy breathing, not from one person but by many.  There must be
an army in here that is surrounding you and preparing to strike!

rooms.Name: Inside a dark holding cell
rooms.Description:
It's dark and dank inside this strange room.  The windows here are all
barred and boarded shut.  Someone wants this place to remain locked but why
would anyone want to do that unless of course, there's someone or
somethings locked inside this large cell.  You can feel something is
watching you from the darkness...something that doesn't seem friendly...

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (main hallway - south)
rooms.Description:
There's a lot of doctors/scientists here walking back and forth attending
to their tasks at hand.  The guards are carefully looking for any possible
intruders that enter this section of the floor.  The main hallway continues
east and west of here.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (main hallway - southwest corner)
rooms.Description:
There's a door south of here and the label on this door reads
'Paranormal/Psychic Research.'  You are curious to enter this room and find
what's behind this door.  Doctors and scientists from around this section
seem to walk in and out from this research office.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (main hallway - west)
rooms.Description:
As you walk along this section of the hallway, you notice immediately the
light coming from the north.  It's bright and very strong...something is
definitely happening there.  There are not a lot of guards here patrolling
this area and they seem to be staying away as far as possible from what 
lies north of here.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (main hallway - west)
rooms.Description:
There's a light coming from north of here and it's very bright.  You are
curious to find out what is causing this light from that direction.  A door
is also west of here and something in there smells funny.  There are 
cigarette smokes coming from beneath that door, and you can hear a faint
whispering inside.

rooms.Name: A white laboratory room
rooms.Description:
This entire room is completely white!  There are strange metallic patient-
beds on the sides of the room and funny-looking medical equipments lying on
tables.  In the middle of the room, there are doctors here dressed in
weird 'costumes' as though they are trying to look like aliens.  These
'doctors' seem to be operating on a woman patient and she looks very
nervous and frightened even in her near-unconscious state.  One of the
doctors here are instructing the others on their performance and he's 
speaking to them in a foreign language...

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (main hallway - east)
rooms.Description:
Almost every scientists and doctors on this floor are going inside that
northern entrance.  The door is guarded by two soldiers who make sure that
the person has the proper access card.  The access panel is next to that
door and it is the only thing that will unlock this heavily-guarded door.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (main hallway - east)
rooms.Description:
Doctors and scientists are moving everywhere around this area as though
something important is happening here.  All the doctors/scientists seem to
head north of here...there must be something there that draws them to that
direction.  You are curious (very curious) to find out what lies north.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (main hallway - east)
rooms.Description:
The first thing you notice when you step into this room is a door east of
where you're standing.  The door is made of the same armored metal as the
elevator door you came from.  Something important must lie behind this
tough barrier and the only thing that keeps you from entering inside is a
certain access card...

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (main hallway - southeast corner)
rooms.Description:
As you walk along this main hallway, you notice that this floor is much
larger than most floors on this building.  There must be something 
important going on in this floor that the F.B.I. doesn't want anyone to
find out about.  The main hallway continues north and west.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (main hallway - south)
rooms.Description:
There's nothing unusual about this area of the hallway.  A room lies just
south of here and the label on that door reads 'Cryogenics Research.'  The
door is left wide open and someone seems to be in there probably testing or
researching on this subject.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (main hallway - south)
rooms.Description:
Just as you step into this area of the hallway, you notice that this place
smells like a hospital.  There are doctors and scientists walking 
everywhere around the hallway back and forth.  Security guards are also
very active as they make sure that no one around here is an 'unauthorized'
visitor.  They are verifying badges and checking on their list to make sure
everyone on this floor are what they seem to be.  It would be smart for you
to avoid these guards when exploring around this section of the hallway.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (west elevator-hallway)
rooms.Description:
This floor doesn't look like any basement floor from any building you've
been in.  The hallway is well-lit and the walls here are painted light blue.
There are also doctors and scientists here walking pass you, and you wonder
to yourself, what would doctors and scientists be doing at the basement
floor of the F.B.I. building?

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (west elevator-hallway)
rooms.Description:
The scientists and doctors are beginning to annoy you as they accidentally
bump into you when they try making their way to their destination point.
Everyone here seems to be in a hurry to get to somewhere.  This hallway
continues north and south of here.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (west elevator-hallway)
rooms.Description:
There's nothing unusual about this area of the hallway.  More doctors and
scientists are passing you going east as though something is happening
there.  Not far east of here, you can see that there is an entrance that
can take you to another hallway.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (exit/entrance elevator-hallway)
rooms.Description:
The entrance to another hallway lies south of here and there seems to be
more activities going on there.  The doctors and scientists are mostly
entering into that part of the area.  There must be something important
that's happening there and it might be dangerous for you to find out what!
From a distance, you can see security guards walking around making sure 
there's no one here that'll cause any trouble.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (east elevator-hallway)
rooms.Description:
The sounds of footsteps by doctors and scientists are pretty loud as they
walk along the concrete hallway.  Some of the doctors here are scampering
quickly about as though they are in a hurry to deliver a baby.  The hallway
continues north and west of here.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (east elevator-hallway)
rooms.Description:
More and more doctors/scientists are passing you by as they seem to be in a
hurry to get to a sick patient.  The basement floor of this building is
suprisingly well-lit and the walls are painted white.  This doesn't look
like any basement floor in any building you've seen.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (east elevator-hallway)
rooms.Description:
There are no soldiers with guns around this area and hardly any special
agents here carrying loads of documents.  This entire area is occupy by
people wearing long white doctor's uniforms.  Hmmm...  what would doctors
(or scientists) be doing here working in the basement floor of this 
building, you think to yourself.

rooms.Name: Basement Floor (elevator-hallway)
rooms.Description:
Just as soon as you step into this area you notice a large gold-plated sign
reading 'Top-Secret area, Authorized Personnel Only.'  The sign is so huge
that it's impossible not to notice it.  There's also a small phrase beneath
this warning sign that reads 'Deny Everything...'  What a strange place
this is, you think to yourself.  This hallway continues east and west.

rooms.Name: Inside the elevator (at the Basement)
rooms.Description:
This underground level of the building looks quite suspicious.  To open
this door one must have priority one status and an access card that can be
validated by the slider.  The door is impossible to pry open because it's
made of some sort of armored metal that you've never seen before...

rooms.Name: Inside the elevator (at the Main Floor)
rooms.Description:
This elevator looks large from the inside and it may probably fit more than
twenty people.  The walls of the elevator are covered by shiny metal plates
much like the elegant hotels in Beverly Hills.  There's a large panel that
is placed next to the exit/entrance of this elevator.  An access card 
slider is also there next to the control panel.

rooms.Name: The Main Floor (east hallway)
rooms.Description:
The people around you are moving quickly back and forth, moving documents
from one place to the other.  The F.B.I. building is always busy during the
day and even during night-time.  This hallway continues north and the
entrance/exit is just west of where you're standing.

rooms.Name: The Main Floor (east hallway)
rooms.Description:
As soon as you enter this section of the main floor, you notice a door just
north of here.  It's a plain office door in the department.  The name plate
on the door reads 'Special Agent Alex Krycek'...he must be one of the
special agents here in the building.

rooms.Name: Alex Krycek's office
rooms.Description:
This office looks neat and tidy.  All you see is a desk in the middle of
the room with a big pile of documents stacked almost close to the ceiling.
This office doesn't seem to have a window much like the other offices here
in the building.  There's a special agent here sitting behind the desk 
whispering on the phone.  He seems to be talking secretly to someone who is
important (judging by the expression on his face).  The agent doesn't seem
to notice your presence in his office.  That phone call must be from
someone of great importance.

rooms.Name: The Main Floor (elevator entrance)
rooms.Description:
It's not a good idea to fool around with the access panel.  It might alert
those hundreds or even thousands of F.B.I. agents to your location.  The
panel requires an insertion of an appropriate access card and only some of
the special agents carry that card.  You might as well just turn back now
because without a special access card, you can't get anywhere besides the
Main Floor.

rooms.Name: The Main Floor (west hallway)
rooms.Description:
Special agents are walking back and forth carrying tons of documents on
their arms.  There's a lot of research and development that need to be 
done around this building in order for a thorough investigation.  To the
east, there seems to be an elevator but there's also an ID validation/
security panel beside it.  Without a proper access card there's no way
you can enter into the other floors.

rooms.Name: The Main Floor (west hallway)
rooms.Description:
This building is nicely maintained by the janitors who work here.  The nice
red carpet looks dustfree and the walls look clear of any dirty fingerprints.
The lighting in this hallway is perfect for any person to conduct their
daily business.

rooms.Name: The Main Floor (west hallway)
rooms.Description:
There's nothing special about this section of the main floor.  The agents
here are too busy minding their own business to stop and chat with you.
The west hallway seems to continue north and the entrance/exit from this
building is just east of here.

rooms.Name: Inside the F.B.I. building
rooms.Description:
Everywhere you look there are special agents walking around the building.
There's nothing special around here that you notice, the interior of this
complex is just like any other building you've been in.  This looks like
the first floor of this building and you can't find the elevator anywhere
close to you.  It must be on the opposite end of this floor.

rooms.Name: On the F.B.I. building perimeter
rooms.Description:
As you pass the gates, you notice the guards here standing close by to make
sure you don't try anything funny.  After you passed that fencing behind
you, the guards suspect that you already had proper authorization to enter
the building so they were not suspicious of your motives.  The F.B.I.
building is just north of here and the door there seems to be unlocked.

rooms.Name: The F.B.I. checkpoint
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this area, you notice a small checkpoint booth.  There's a
guard inside this booth who looks like he's ready to pull out his pistol
and shoot someone.  Without verification, no one may pass the tall electric
fencing that surrounds this entire complex.  Only the F.B.I. agents and
maybe a few government officials may pass through this gate.

ExtraDescs.Description:
This gate is the only entrance to the F.B.I. building and it's locked
tight.  The only way to get pass it is to either get the key from the
guard or get someone who has the skill to pick a lock.

rooms.Name: End of President Avenue
rooms.Description:
Finally, you've arrived at the end of this long road.  The activities
around here are lesser than the other parts of this street.  To your north,
there's a walkway that'll take you to a large complex.  The sign there seems
to read 'Federal Bureau of Investigations.'  That must be the building where
those F.B.I. people gather together for a nation-wide assignment.  There's
a large fence from a distance and there are security guards that surrounds
the building.

rooms.Name: President Avenue
rooms.Description:
There's nothing unusual about this area of the road.  More people are
walking pass you and they seem to be in a hurry.  No one is taking time to
slow down and everyone seems to be trying to beat a deadline.  Cars on the
road are just as busy as the people on the sidewalks but they don't move as
fast due to this street's one-lane traffic.

rooms.Name: President Avenue
rooms.Description:
As you walk further along this road, you see more and more people 
scampering all along the sidewalk.  Everyone is busy with something and no
one seems to have time to stop to say 'hi' to you.  The business men and
women here are all carrying the same boring brown briefcases and wearing
dull grey/blue suits.  You're the only person here who dresses like a 
'normal' person but people around here are too busy to notice that.

rooms.Name: President Avenue
rooms.Description:
There's nothing going on around you.  Everyone looks like they're busy with
one thing or another and no one here has time to show you directions.  This
scenic route is beginning to bore you.  There's no excitement here and
everything seems to look dull to you.  The people here all dress the same
and the buildings look alike.  This road seems to continue north and west
of where you're standing.

rooms.Name: Fox Mulder's apartment
rooms.Description:
You notice this room is dark, very dark...  But the television is left on
by someone who may or may not be still here.  It looks like a taping of an
alien autopsy program of some sort.  As you look around this smelly, messy
apartment you'll notice the large stacks of tabloid magazines left all over
the floor.  There are also source books and journals everywhere.  The nut
living here must be a paranoid 'alien-researcher' judging by his taste in
reading materials and his selected programming.

rooms.Name: 13th Floor
rooms.Description:
This is the only floor where there is a light coming from the hallway.
There must be someone living on this floor, probably the only person living
in this entire building.  The hallway seems to look nice unlike the
downstair's.  The red carpet is vacuumed and the cobwebs on the ceiling seem
to be absent.  To your east, you notice an old wooden door.

rooms.Name: Walking on the old concrete stairway
rooms.Description:
You feel you're not alone just as soon as you reach this part of the
stairway.  There is something that is staring down at you but you can't see
what it is.  Your heart is starting to pound so fast that it's about to
burst.  You notice a dim light just a few more steps from you.

rooms.Name: Walking on the old concrete stairway
rooms.Description:
You are appalled by the conditions in this large building.  There are
cockroaches everywhere and you can hear yourself stepping over and cracking
their tiny hard eggs which are scattered everywhere.  It's dark in this
stairway and there's no light here that'll guide you towards your destination.

rooms.Name: Inside a 3rd-rate hotel
rooms.Description:
Just as soon as you enter this old building, you can see rats on the floor
gnawing at your shoes.  You gasp in horror as you kick them away and
squish some of them with your large boots.  Who could live in such a
dump, you think to yourself.  There's a stairway that will take you to the
upper floors.  The antique elevator seems to be out-of-order.

rooms.Name: Alien Road
rooms.Description:
The sunlight from above is quickly covered by a strange mist!  This road
looks more like an alley for bums to live in.  It's so dark in here you
can bearly even move around.  There's a large building on the end of this
short and narrow road.  The old building looks like some cheap hotel and
it doesn't look very sturdy as you can see the cracks all along the sides
of this mammoth complex.

rooms.Name: President Avenue
rooms.Description:
There's nothing unusual about this road nor this part of the area.  People
all around you are scampering as though they have a deadline of some sort
in a business project.  As you walk further along this road you notice an
intersection that stretches to your south.  This southern road looks narrow
and dark much like that eerie roadway that you came from earlier...

rooms.Name: President Avenue
rooms.Description:
The sky is beginning to clear as you walk further along this well-paved
road.  the fog is disappearing as quickly as the clouds in the sky.  You
can feel the sunlight shining above you and the sounds of birds singing
everywhere.  There are a few people walking this street doing their daily
business.  The road continues east and west.

rooms.Name: The research lab/library
rooms.Description:
Books and books are everywhere you look...  The shelves that hold these
books seem to be getting weaker and weaker by the moment.  There are 
scientific newspapers and journals stacked head-high on the floor which
leaves very little space for you to walk on.

rooms.Name: The printing press
rooms.Description:
There's a large printing press that is lying in the middle of the room.  It
looks as though it has been turned on all night and has been printing non-
stop.  You can see the articles that are being printed by this large
press...it reads 'Government denies everything...Clinton has been abducted
by aliens...'  This must be some sort of a tabloid newspaper operation but
why are the people here printing this paper inside this place, you think to
yourself.  Why the secrecy over these unbelievable, exaggerated stories?

rooms.Name: The computer/surveillance room
rooms.Description:
Everywhere you look there's a computer there that is turned on and 
configuring some strange data.  Wires and circuit breakers are everywhere
along the floor.  There are research papers and science books that are left
all over the place.  As you turn your head towards the corner of the room,
you notice a poorly-dressed man working diligently on his computer.

rooms.Name: Inside the Lone Gunmen
rooms.Description:
It's dark in here but you sense someone or something is living in this
dump.  You can hear whispering and the tapping of keys as though someone
was typing on a computer keyboard.  There are some dim, flickering lights
just a few feet from where you're standing.  Now you know there are 
definitely someone living in this supposedly abandoned building.

rooms.Name: President Avenue
rooms.Description:
The fog seems to suddenly disappear...  You can feel the warm sunshine
showering you from above, and the birds around you are singing a beautiful
tune.  To the west there's a small white building standing there.  It looks
deserted because the windows and all of its exits are boarded up.  The
board that covers the small back exit seems to be loose...

rooms.Name: The end of X Street
rooms.Description:
It seems this street ends here and you see an intersection from your left
and right.  You try to point your light-source at the street sign to find
where you're at.  The street sign reads 'President Avenue.'  You must be in
Washington D.C. and walking along one of this State's most popular road.
As you look around you notice some people walking around, some people here
are jogging and walking their dogs, etc.  Everything here looks normal
unlike the abandon road that you came from.

rooms.Name: Walking on X Street
rooms.Description:
The fog is so thick that you're beginning to run into things.  You try hard
to find your way out of this fog but it seems to follow you wherever you
go.  Even with your light-source you find it difficult to see where you are
headed.  This street looks like it ends close by but you're not sure...

rooms.Name: Walking on X Street
rooms.Description:
You sense the fog around you is beginning to thicken.  It's only mid-day
and the sky is beginning to go dark.  You can hear the dogs howling as you
walk closer and closer down the street.  The houses that you pass by look
as though they're vacant.  Everywhere you look there are no lights coming
from the porches nor the streetlights.

rooms.Name: The beginning of X Street
rooms.Description:
As soon as you walk onto this road, you notice something is watching you.
You can hear footsteps and whispering behind you.  There's something moving
behind those thick bushes but it could be just cats prowling around the
night.  You sense a light fog is surrounding you as you walk slowly, slowly
down this eerie street...
There's a small, painted sign on the side of this road.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Welcome to Nigel's         XXXX     XXXX
                                   X       X
                                     X   X
            T H E          ( X ) - F I L E S          Z O N E
                                     X   X
                                   X       X
                                 XXXX     XXXX

                     "The Truth is Out There..."

      The X-Files (tm) (c) is produced by Ten Thirteen Productions in
      association with Fox Television and Chris Carter.

rooms.Name: Section Chief Joseph McGrath's office
rooms.Description:
There's nothing special about this room except for the steel file cabinets
that are set against the walls.  You can see a man sitting behind a desk
looking through personnel files and writing long notes.  The room here is
well-lit and the windows are wide-opened.  This entire room looks pretty
clean except for the hundreds and thousands of files that are neatly
piled up on almost every available space.
